result.execSummary:
The defendant Chipper D Haley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Defendant Chipper D Haley in court with attorney Andrew Charles Ladd.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Ladd makes statements.  Defendant's mother makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1. 

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

1 year Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  

Term of Probation: 2 Years

Conditions of Probation:
	
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
	
No contact with Chad Kraft, Benjamin Medina, Walgreens on Sunset Drive in Waukesha. 

Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;

Anger management  counseling to be determined by Agent.  

Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.

Condition Time: 60 days Huber NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS, last 40 days stayed.   - To commence 5:00 pm October 10, 2016. 

COSTS : WAIVED

DNA Surcharge: WAIVED

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
